intro: Oplismenus gracilis, commonly known as slender woodsorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, upright stems that bear small, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive veining pattern. The plant produces delicate white or yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Botanically, it is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and is part of the Oxalidaceae family.
